message: (This is abuse, not an argument, so yes, something disparaging would be appropriate. Perhaps something about my parents, or maybe my siblings?)
(Sorry. Would you like me to say something disparaging as well?)

I really can't stand the arrogance of the Twisted crowd. I mean, honestly, "MostAwesomeDude" says everything it needs to about intellectual snobbery and gender bias, doesn't it? Abuse? Come back when you're worth abusing, kiddie, and just run along for now. WE can abuse your parents when we have evidence that you have any. I've known the Twisted crowd long enough to know that you are probably a 23-line Twisted program on some server somewhere. [Thinks: did I say that last bit out loud?]
Oh, and I need to flame as well, right? My flame: Man, I wish Twisted had the ability to stop TLS without closing the connection!
@holdenweb Ever seen Bill & Ted? :3
@lvh Are my specialchars getting munched? I was talking about Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure, of course.
@MostAwesomeDude What makes you believe that?
Ever wanted to flame Twisted? Here's your chance!

Oh, by the way: there's some bloggy introductions to Twisted I really like: http://krondo.com/?page_id=1327 . It starts by assuming you don't know anything yet about concurrency models, and then explains stuff. It's pretty cool.
@holdenweb Is it because of the people you hang around with that you say "MostAwesomeDude" says everything it needs to about intellectual snobbery and gender bias, doesn't it?

@MostAwesomeDude Why do you say 
ever seen bill ted 3?

@lvh I tend to have a pretty good grasp of what I'm talking about. Otherwise, I wouldn't be able to talk about it. Or is that a tautology? I'm not so great with logic. I'm far better with sarcasm and Internets.
@MostAwesomeDude Well, what was supposed to be a comedic roasting kind of morphed in the face of my absence of cultural referents. That's what I get for being an immigrant, I suppose. Never mind.
@MostAwesomeDude Please answer http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5130080/why-is-there-a-handshake-failure-when-trying-to-run-tls-over-tls-with-this-code then

@holdenweb Wall o' text. "Most awesome, dude!" is from Bill & Ted, and I acquired it when I was still young. It's a reminder to me to be excellent to people around me. While I might not be a bot, I certainly have written quite a lot of Twisted app code, and I feel that it's superior to the other networking libraries.
I respect twisted as a lifestyle choice.  It is not a lifestyle I have chosen to live, however.
Twisted shouldn't hide @defer.inlineCallbacks as that's really pro.
Twisted shouldn't *have* defer.inlineCallbacks.
Heh. I don't really use it myself, but I don't see its presence as a problem. If anything it's a benefit because of the possibility of portable async code.
@lvh Supposing you mean "portable across different libraries of functionality provided asynchronously", I don't see anything about inlineCallbacks which is more portable.
@jpcalderone Wasn't that the intent of Monocle? (The idea being that generators apparently mapped fairly well to a bunch of different libraries.)

@lvh I think the intent of Monocle was mainly to implement something like inlineCallbacks (the author didn't know about inlineCallbacks until after he released Monocle).  The fact that Monocle has multiple... "backends"? is a little bit confusing.  Perhaps someone who has used it to write portable asynchronous code can chime in and explain it.  As far as I can tell though, you don't gain a lot, since if you're using twisted.web.client.getPage in a Monocle-decorated generator, you can't suddenly switch to Tornado!  An asynchronous API provided by one library still won't run in the main loop of another.  Supporting that would require a lot more cooperation than Monocle attempts to provide, and once you accomplish it I don't think you are really tied to things like Monocle (or inlineCallbacks) to take advantage of portability.
Yeah, okay: there's the small problem of it not actually working ;-) (Such a killjoy, jp)
@lvh Eliza, is that you?

I feel like Twisted is like Tai Chi or some kind of advanced Yoga or meditation or something, where if you don't do it every single day of your life you're inevitably going to forget some key move and you're going to look clumsy all over again. It's not that I can't understand it, it's that I can't keep it in my brain and come back to it for one project per year.
@jonesy no you won't forget the moves of Tai Chi... but Twisted does
@MostAwesomeDude WHOOSH!
